DataElement.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tumor Tissue Time To Fixation Minute Duration Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the time in minutes between sample acquisition and effective fixation in formalin and embedding in paraffin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tumor Tissue Time To Fixation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04)_Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin._Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin_A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Formaldehyde Fixed Specimen Tissue, Paraffin Tumor Tissue
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04):Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.:Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin:A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:The preservation and hardening of a tissue sample to retain as nearly as possible the same relations they had in the living body.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Kidney Chromophobe form per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 7/16/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time in minutes (nnnn.nn) that it takes for an event or activity to take place from beginning to end.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
